event.location: The incident occurred along the banks of a river in Central Peru
event.summary: 08/18/1993: Shining Path guerillas massacred Ashaninka Indian communities situated along the banks of a river valley in the Amazon jungle in central Peru. Sixty-two were killed.
event.target1: Ashaninka Indian communities along the banks of the Amazon jungle
event.motive: To punish the natives for deserting the Shining Path's ranks.
event.scite1: “Indians massacred in Peru; Maoist rebels kill up to 62, injure 34,” Seattle Post-Intelligencer, August 21, 1993.
event.scite2: “Shining Path attack raises questions about pacification program,” Agence France Presse, August 20, 1993.
event.scite3: “Suspects in massacre seized,” The Herald (Glasgow), August 30, 1993.
